Title: KDE Libraries: Multiple vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in KDE Libraries, the
    worst of which could lead to man-in-the-middle attacks.

Background.Text: KDE is a feature-rich graphical desktop environment for Linux and Unix-like operating systems. KDE Libraries contains libraries needed by all KDE applications.

Description.Text: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in KDE Libraries. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could cause a man-in-the-middle attack via any certificate issued by a legitimate certification authority. Furthermore, a local attacker may gain knowledge of user passwords through an information leak.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All KDE users should upgrade to the latest version:
